io.artframework

Interface Action<TTarget>

  • Type Parameters:
    TTarget - the target this action applies to. This could be a player, entity or anything as long as there is a trigger for it.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ArtObject, ResultCreator
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActionContext<TTarget>, GenericAction
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultActionContext
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Action<TTarget>
extends ArtObject, ResultCreator
    Defines an action that can get executed if the right Trigger was called. The implementing class must have a public parameterless constructor or you need to provide a ArtObjectProvider for the type and register it with the ActionProvider.add(Class, ArtObjectProvider).

    The Trigger source and action target must match or the action will not be executed. Make the TTarget as broad as possible to allow the action to be executed by as many triggers as possible.

    You can use any field in this class as a config option as long as you annotate it with @ConfigOption.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Result execute(@NonNull Target<TTarget> target, @NonNull ExecutionContext<ActionContext<TTarget>> context)
      Called when the action is executed.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.artframework.ResultCreator

        cancelled, empty, error, error, failure, resultOf, resultOf, success

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        Result execute(@NonNull
               @NonNull Target<TTarget> target,
               @NonNull
               @NonNull ExecutionContext<ActionContext<TTarget>> context)
        Called when the action is executed. The action should handle the pure execution and no filtering. All filtering is done beforehand and by the means of attached Requirements. Use the @ConfigOption annotation on fields of this class to provide configuration options for users of this action.

        Make sure to annotate this Action with a @ART and optionally provide a config class and implement Configurable.

        Parameters:
        target - the target of this action
        context - context of this action. Use the ExecutionContext to retrieve the config and a lot of additional information about the execution.
        Returns:
        the result of the action execution. Use the ResultCreator.success(String...) and ResultCreator.failure(String...) methods to create the result.
